intro: Afrocanthium burttii subsp. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth Afrocanthium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The subspecies glabrum is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves. It typically grows in grassy areas and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
